Articles.Content:
Hi,

In the general case, is it reasonable to say build a mod targeted at .Net 4.0 or higher and expect it to integrate cleanly with KSP 0.90 which is currently targeted at .Net 3.5?

I ask because I came across a mod today with code containing the Tuple<T1, T2> syntax which after checking the MDN appears to be available from .NET Framework 4 onwards.

Edited January 3, 2015 by BruceKnowles
Some mods are compiled against 4.0 but they often cause issues and incompatibilities. I think Unity's version of Mono is still predominantly .NET 3.5 even though it has some of the pieces of 4.0
